item.title: Carli add a quote by Cadet Maxim
item.description: "Risk more than others think is safe, care more than others think is wise, dream more than others think is practical, expect more than others think is possible." -- Cadet Maxim

item.title: Carli add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Your cause of sorrow must not be measured by his worth, for then it hath no end." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Carli add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Now cracks a noble heart. Good-night, sweet prince; And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest. " -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Carli add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "When men take up arms to set other men free, there is something sacred and holy in the warfare." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Carli add a quote by E.M.Forster
item.description: "I hate the idea of causes, and if I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country." -- E.M.Forster

item.title: Carli add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Thus ended the great American Civil War, which must upon the whole be considered the noblest and least avoidable of all the great mass conflicts of which till then there was record." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Carli add a quote by Michael Shaara
item.description: "Why do there have to be men like that, men who enjoy another man's dying?" -- Michael Shaara

item.title: Carli add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Carli add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Carli add a quote by Oscar Levant
item.description: "There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line." -- Oscar Levant

item.title: Carli add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Carli add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Carli add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Carli add a quote by Edwin Denby
item.description: "There is a bit of insanity in dancing that does everybody a great deal of good. " -- Edwin Denby

item.title: Carli add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
